header: Cri. Bail Appl. No. 206/2019 (CNR No. : MHPU01­000785­2019) Kanchan Ingale Vs. State of Maharashtra

background.text: ORDER BELOW EXH. 4 1] This is an application by Kanchan Sachin Ingale for Ad­ interim Anticipatory Bail under Section 438 of the Code of Criminal Procedure in respect of Crime No.13/2019 registered under Sections 376, 313, 323, 504, 506 read with Section 34 of Indian Penal Code at Police Station, Paud, Dist. Pune.

legalActFound.stringMatched: under section 438 of the code of criminal procedure
under sections 376, 313, 323, 504, 506 read with section 34 of indian penal code

arguments.text: 2] Informant is a married and deserted lady of 27 years. She alleged that, she got acquainted with accused No. 1 Sachin in September 2015. They used to meet. In December 2015, accused No. 1 Sachin assured her for marriage and committed sexual intercourse with her in a lodge and then repeatedly accused No. 1 Sachin used to give assurance of marriage and used to keep physical relations with her. Meanwhile, she got pregnant. That time, accused No.2 Pandurang and present Applicant who is wife of accused Sachin gave understanding to her and abortion was taken place. Thereafter, also in May 2018, again Informant got pregnant and accused No.1 Sachin made her to abort. Hence, she lodged the report.

argumentSentences.text: 2] Informant is a married and deserted lady of 27 years.
She alleged that, she got acquainted with accused No. 1 Sachin in September 2015.
They used to meet.

In December 2015, accused No. 1 Sachin assured her for marriage and committed sexual intercourse with her in a lodge and then repeatedly accused No. 1 Sachin used to give assurance of marriage and used to keep physical relations with her.
Meanwhile, she got pregnant.
That time, accused No.2 Pandurang and present Applicant who is wife of accused Sachin gave understanding to her and abortion was taken place.
Thereafter, also in May 2018, again Informant got pregnant and accused No.1 Sachin made her to abort.
Hence, she lodged the report.

arguments.text: 3] Applicant submits that, she has no concern with the alleged offences. She is a lady. She annexed medical papers along with the application and submitted that, at present she is pregnant of seven weeks and doctor advised her for bed­rest. If, she has been arrested, she would suffer great hardship. Hence, she prays for interim protection.

argumentSentences.text: 3] Applicant submits that, she has no concern with the alleged offences.
She is a lady.
She annexed medical papers along with the application and submitted that, at present she is pregnant of seven weeks and doctor advised her for bed­rest.
If, she has been arrested, she would suffer great hardship.
Hence, she prays for interim protection.

arguments.text: 4] Heard Adv. B. A. Aloor for Applicant. Perused the Papers.

argumentSentences.text: 4] Heard Adv. B. A. Aloor for Applicant.
Perused the Papers.

arguments.text: 5] Prima facie, role attributed to Applicant is to the extent that, being wife of accused No.1 Sachin, she had given understanding to Informant for abortion. Considering the alleged role, no immediate recovery is seen. Applicant is lady, moreover presently pregnant. Therefore, she needs interim protection. Hence, I prefer to pass following Order.

argumentSentences.text: 5] Prima facie, role attributed to Applicant is to the extent that, being wife of accused No.1 Sachin, she had given understanding to Informant for abortion.
Considering the alleged role, no immediate recovery is seen.
Applicant is lady, moreover presently pregnant.
Therefore, she needs interim protection.
Hence, I prefer to pass following Order.

order.text: ORDER 1] Application is allowed. 2] Pending hearing and final disposal of the main application, in the event of arrest in Crime No. 13/2019 registered under Sections 376, 313, 323, 504, 506 read with Section 34 of Indian Penal Code at Police Station, Paud, Dist. Pune, Applicant Kanchan Sachin Ingale be released on bail on furnishing P.B. and S.B. of Rs. 15,000/­ (Rupees Fifteen Thousand) on the following conditions : [i] Applicant shall make herself available for interrogation by a Police Officer as and when required. [ii] Applicant shall not, directly or indirectly, make any inducement, threat or promise to any person acquainted with the facts of the case so as to dissuade them from disclosing such facts to the Court or to any police officer. 3] Issue Notice to Respondent/State, returnable on 23/01/2019. 4] Intimate to concern Police Station.

processedText:
Cri. Bail Appl. No. 206/2019 (CNR No. : MHPU01­000785­2019) Kanchan Ingale Vs. State of Maharashtra 
---header-ends---
ORDER BELOW EXH. 4 1] This is an application by Kanchan Sachin Ingale for Ad­ interim Anticipatory Bail under Section 438 of the Code of Criminal Procedure in respect of Crime No.13/2019 registered under Sections 376, 313, 323, 504, 506 read with Section 34 of Indian Penal Code at Police Station, Paud, Dist. Pune. 
---background-ends---
2] Informant is a married and deserted lady of 27 years. She alleged that, she got acquainted with accused No. 1 Sachin in September 2015. They used to meet. In December 2015, accused No. 1 Sachin assured her for marriage and committed sexual intercourse with her in a lodge and then repeatedly accused No. 1 Sachin used to give assurance of marriage and used to keep physical relations with her. Meanwhile, she got pregnant. That time, accused No.2 Pandurang and present Applicant who is wife of accused Sachin gave understanding to her and abortion was taken place. Thereafter, also in May 2018, again Informant got pregnant and accused No.1 Sachin made her to abort. Hence, she lodged the report. 
---argument-ends---
3] Applicant submits that, she has no concern with the alleged offences. She is a lady. She annexed medical papers along with the application and submitted that, at present she is pregnant of seven weeks and doctor advised her for bed­rest. If, she has been arrested, she would suffer great hardship. Hence, she prays for interim protection. 
---argument-ends---
4] Heard Adv. B. A. Aloor for Applicant. Perused the Papers. 
---argument-ends---
5] Prima facie, role attributed to Applicant is to the extent that, being wife of accused No.1 Sachin, she had given understanding to Informant for abortion. Considering the alleged role, no immediate recovery is seen. Applicant is lady, moreover presently pregnant. Therefore, she needs interim protection. Hence, I prefer to pass following Order. 
---argument-ends---
ORDER 1] Application is allowed. 2] Pending hearing and final disposal of the main application, in the event of arrest in Crime No. 13/2019 registered under Sections 376, 313, 323, 504, 506 read with Section 34 of Indian Penal Code at Police Station, Paud, Dist. Pune, Applicant Kanchan Sachin Ingale be released on bail on furnishing P.B. and S.B. of Rs. 15,000/­ (Rupees Fifteen Thousand) on the following conditions : [i] Applicant shall make herself available for interrogation by a Police Officer as and when required. [ii] Applicant shall not, directly or indirectly, make any inducement, threat or promise to any person acquainted with the facts of the case so as to dissuade them from disclosing such facts to the Court or to any police officer. 3] Issue Notice to Respondent/State, returnable on 23/01/2019. 4] Intimate to concern Police Station. 
---order-ends---
sd/­xxx Pune. (Smt. A. V. Rotte) Date : 11/01/2019. Additional Sessions Judge,Pune ..2.. C E R T I F I C A T E I affirm that the contents of this P. D. Gudde, Stenographer (Grade­II) Date of Order :­ 11/01/2019 Order signed by presiding officer :­ 11/01/2019 Order uploaded on :­ 11/01/2019. ..3..
